div.p:
Am sorry to say I am
still here in durance vile - but matters are
in a fair way now for effecting my escape
I could not get drivers - people were all
so afraid of going Northward - I have made
arrangements with two Hottentots and
think I shall be off positively before the
next moon - the delays which have
occurred have prevented me falling into
Boerish hands so I am thankful and
indulge the hope that God has still some
little work for me to do - The belief that
my hindrances from the Cape off to
the Kuruman are providential makes
me submit with a good grace -

Fine fellows you Cape worthies are
Mr Fairbairn tells his contemporaries that
the connection of the Dutch Church with
the state is very slender - and you believe
it of course - They get £200 per annum
and the state appoints the ministers - or
has all the patronage in its hands - our
connection with the society is half as
slight again for we only get £100

I have sent a paper on the Caffre war to the B.Bulletin Quart.Quarterly - If this is blabbed
by the DrDoctor I shall not write any more for him

He of course knows what sort of people
he is speaking to - Humph. Sir George C.Cathcart
tells the Caffres that they may recievereceive the
Goika warriors into their houses - Receipt
of stolen goods is no crime in his eyes
ItsIt's for any sake take them away - I can't beat
them. Boohoo O thou mighty man of
valour that's "extermination" "driving over
the Kei" - "unconditional submission"
"complete subjugation" - and £500 for
Nitboalders head too - I intend to offer
£5000 for the LionsLion's Head which looks
down at Church square - saw Lion's
head to be delivered at Lattakoo and
I give you the first offer - What
unutterable meanessmeanness this Sir George
Gibbet Cathcart can be guilty of - &
a Scotchman too - Did I not tell
you we Scotchmen are a bad set -
I dontdon't understand your questions about
responsibility - the superintendent will
get all the blame of everything bad
if he allows the committees to do wrong
I think the Directors will do so - In Africa
we all blame each other and we are blamed
by every body else - Make them all
independantindependent thatsthat's my advice

P.S.Post Script By this post I send 10 letters
addressed to your care and Post
paid as far as Cape Town. There
is no use in attempting to pay
beyond that - You must open
an account against me and
put down Postage - Forage
and all other monies expended
on my behalf - I enclose a letter
to Mr Macgibbon of the Botanic
gardens and if you can spare
time to glance over it you
may oblige me in one of your
walks next winter by putting
him in remembrance
Macgibbon's letter contains
seeds. 2 of the above named
letters are for yourself. I say
"put down all monies &c." What
hypocrisy! if honest I would
say you may either put it
down or not I see no prospect
of ever paying you - If I live
to come back to Cape Town
I shall get a share of Mr Moll's
parlour in the house by the jetty
or a lodging in the Union Workhouse
Please request Mr Pococke to
get a supply of vaccine virus
from the institution for me
I forgot it - If you are acquainted
with the officer he will do it better
& send it post free - I shall probably
draw £12 for Mebaloe - This is
all the business I have to transact
or trouble you with

One of the letters is for America
through Captain Holmes &
you ^ will perhaps be good enough
to present my kind remembrance
to him - As the post is not
going for an hour or two
I may have time to write
another letter, which will
be eleven. to your care
